task.title: Manage Images
task.shortdesc: This screen allows you to view a list of your images and launch images from an image. You can page through the list of images by clicking the navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen.

step.cmd: You can toggle between the table view and the grid view by clicking the appropriate icon next to the View label at the top right of the screen.
Sort the images list by selecting a sort order using the Sort by drop-down list box.

task.title: Searching and Filtering the Images List

step.cmd: To perform a simple search/filter, type some search text into the search text box at the top right of the page.
For more precise filtering and searching, you can add one or more filters by clicking one of the available filters in the Filter by section on the right side of the page.

task.title: Viewing Details of an Image
task.shortdesc: Several items in the image list allow you to click on them to see more detailed information.

taskbody.context: To see more details about an image, or an object associated with an instance:

step.cmd: Click the name/ID in the list of images to display detailed information about the selected image.

task.title: Actions
task.shortdesc: If an image is available and not in the process of being created (status "pending"), each entry in the image list has a context menu, accessible in the Actions column. Clicking the action icon brings up a menu of actions that you can perform on the selected image.

taskbody.context: The following context menu actions are available:

task.title: View details
task.shortdesc: This option is available whether the image is available or in the process of being created.

step.cmd: This item will bring up the image detail page.

task.title: Launch instance
task.shortdesc: This option is only available if the image is available.

step.cmd: Selecting this menu will display a dialog that allows you to launch an instance using the selected image.

task.title: Create launch configuration
task.shortdesc: This option is only available if the image is available.

step.cmd: A launch configuration is used to define the parameters for new images that are launched as part of your auto scaling group. Selecting this menu displays the Create new launch configuration wizard.

info.note: For more information on Auto Scaling, please see Using Auto Scaling in the Eucalyptus User Guide.

task.title: Remove from cloud
task.shortdesc: The Remove from cloud option is used to clean up images that are no longer needed. Once removed, it will become de-registered but can be re-registered if its snapshot has not been deleted. This option is only available if the image is available.

step.cmd: Selecting this menu displays the Remove image from cloud confirmation window.
To confirm, click Yes, Remove Image from the Cloud.
